item.title: LibGDX
item.description: LibGDX is an open source cross-platform game and visualization development framework in Java. Write your game once and run it on Windows, Linux, Mac OS X, Android, iOS, and HTML5. Link to some of my favourite games Paperama by FDG Entertainment GmbH & Co.KG Halfway by Robotality Zombie Age 3 by DivMob Epic Heroes War by DivMob Tap Tap Dash By Cheetah Games DISTRAINT: Pocket Pixel Horror by Jesse Makkonen

item.title: Google Sign in LibGDX (IOS)
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to integrate Google-Sign in LibGDX. I assume that you’re familiar with LibGDX and Google Sign-In flow. I’ll explain how to integrate Google-Sign in iOS module of LibGDX. This is based on MobiDevelop’s Google Sign-in Robopods. Pre-requisites It is assumed that you have: LibGDX project with ios module, use standard gdx-setup wizard Get an OAuth client ID & URL scheme for your project from here Download 3rd party native framework for your iOS module, instruction here
